page.title: 07A Visit to Croxteth Hall
page.content: {Croxteth Hall}is very big, very nice and has lots of lovely things in- side. There are patterned windows. Inside are old-fashioned dresses, tables and chairs from long ago. Near the Hall there is a walled garden. The walls used to have heating inside them so peaches would grow there. Now it is a gardening centre where they teach you how to plant things. In the souvenir shop they sell various things including eggs from the hens at the farm. You can buy sweets, ice cream & cold drinks. On the farm they keep horses, pigs, rabbits, hens, sheep with curly horns and cows, but they are mainly unusual breeds. There is a horse riding centre and when you are good at it they let you ride round the park by yourself. When you are twelve you can work in the stables. Samantha Machell & Karen Baker
